intro: Notothixos cornifolius, commonly known as the horned leaf plant, is a unique species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, waxy leaves that are often shaped like horns, giving it its common name. The plant has a compact growth habit and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. Its flowering stems produce small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
